titlestmt.titleproper: George Catlin collection from the Thomas Gilcrease Institute of American History and Art

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:23:15 -0400.

did.unittitle: George Catlin collection from the Thomas Gilcrease Institute of American History and Art

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters from Catlin to Sir Thomas Phillipps, 1840-1860, and 2 letters from Phillipps to Catlin; writings by Catlin; material on Catlin's Indian Gallery, including clippings, catalogs, handbills, invitations, Indian drawings, and printed material; a watercolor sketchbook; a list of paintings; Indian portrait sketches; and miscellany.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 3277 (frames 494-1305) available at Archives of American Art offices, the Thomas Gilcrease Institute of American History and Art, the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston, and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals in: Thomas Gilcrease Institute of American History and Art, Tulsa, Oklahoma.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Portrait painter, miniature painter, ethnographer; Pennsylvania Best known for his paintings of the American Indian. Born in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Microfilmed 1984 along with other selected art related papers from the Gilcrease Institute.
